options.name: --help
options.description: show this help message and exit

options.name: --rcfile
options.description: Specify a configuration file to load.

options.name: --output
options.description: Specify an output file.

options.name: --help-msg
options.description: Display a help message for the given message id and exit. The value may be a comma separated list of message ids.

options.name: --list-msgs
options.description: Display a list of all pylint's messages divided by whether they are emittable with the given interpreter.

options.name: --list-msgs-enabled
options.description: Display a list of what messages are enabled, disabled and non-emittable with the given configuration.

options.name: --list-groups
options.description: List pylint's message groups.

options.name: --list-conf-levels
options.description: Generate pylint's confidence levels.

options.name: --list-extensions
options.description: List available extensions.

options.name: --full-documentation
options.description: Generate pylint's full documentation.

options.name: --generate-rcfile
options.description: Generate a sample configuration file according to the current configuration. You can put other options before this one to get them in the generated configuration.

options.name: --generate-toml-config
options.description: Generate a sample configuration file according to the current configuration. You can put other options before this one to get them in the generated configuration. The config is in the .toml format.

options.name: --long-help
options.description: Show more verbose help.

options.name: --init-hook
options.description: Python code to execute, usually for sys.path manipulation such as pygtk.require().

options.name: --errors-only
options.description: In error mode, messages with a category besides ERROR or FATAL are suppressed, and no reports are done by default. Error mode is compatible with disabling specific errors.

options.name: --verbose
options.description: In verbose mode, extra non-checker-related info will be displayed.

options.name: --enable-all-extensions
options.description: Load and enable all available extensions. Use --list-extensions to see a list all available extensions.

options.name: --ignore
options.description: Files or directories to be skipped. They should be base names, not paths. (default: ('CVS',))

options.name: --ignore-patterns
options.description: Files or directories matching the regular expression patterns are skipped. The regex matches against base names, not paths. The default value ignores Emacs file locks (default: (re.compile('^\.#'),))

options.name: --ignore-paths
options.description: Add files or directories matching the regular expressions patterns to the ignore-list. The regex matches against paths and can be in Posix or Windows format. Because '\\' represents the directory delimiter on Windows systems, it can't be used as an escape character. (default: [])

options.name: --persistent
options.description: Pickle collected data for later comparisons. (default: True)

options.name: --load-plugins
options.description: List of plugins (as comma separated values of python module names) to load, usually to register additional checkers. (default: ())

options.name: --fail-under
options.description: Specify a score threshold under which the program will exit with error. (default: 10)

options.name: --fail-on
options.description: Return non-zero exit code if any of these messages/categories are detected, even if score is above --fail-under value. Syntax same as enable. Messages specified are enabled, while categories only check already-enabled messages. (default: )

options.name: --jobs
options.description: Use multiple processes to speed up Pylint. Specifying 0 will auto-detect the number of processors available to use, and will cap the count on Windows to avoid hangs. (default: 1)

options.name: --limit-inference-results
options.description: Control the amount of potential inferred values when inferring a single object. This can help the performance when dealing with large functions or complex, nested conditions. (default: 100)

options.name: --extension-pkg-allow-list
options.description: A comma-separated list of package or module names from where C extensions may be loaded. Extensions are loading into the active Python interpreter and may run arbitrary code. (default: [])

options.name: --extension-pkg-whitelist
options.description: A comma-separated list of package or module names from where C extensions may be loaded. Extensions are loading into the active Python interpreter and may run arbitrary code. (This is an alternative name to extension-pkg-allow-list for backward compatibility.) (default: [])

options.name: --suggestion-mode
options.description: When enabled, pylint would attempt to guess common misconfiguration and emit user-friendly hints instead of false-positive error messages. (default: True)

options.name: --exit-zero
options.description: Always return a 0 (non-error) status code, even if lint errors are found. This is primarily useful in continuous integration scripts. (default: False)

options.name: --from-stdin
options.description: Interpret the stdin as a python script, whose filename needs to be passed as the module_or_package argument. (default: False)

options.name: --source-roots
options.description: Add paths to the list of the source roots. Supports globbing patterns. The source root is an absolute path or a path relative to the current working directory used to determine a package namespace for modules located under the source root. (default: ())

options.name: --recursive
options.description: Discover python modules and packages in the file system subtree. (default: False)

options.name: --py-version
options.description: Minimum Python version to use for version dependent checks. Will default to the version used to run pylint. (default: (3, 13))

options.name: --ignored-modules
options.description: List of module names for which member attributes should not be checked and will not be imported (useful for modules/projects where namespaces are manipulated during runtime and thus existing member attributes cannot be deduced by static analysis). It supports qualified module names, as well as Unix pattern matching. (default: ())

options.name: --analyse-fallback-blocks
options.description: Analyse import fallback blocks. This can be used to support both Python 2 and 3 compatible code, which means that the block might have code that exists only in one or another interpreter, leading to false positives when analysed. (default: False)

options.name: --clear-cache-post-run
options.description: Clear in-memory caches upon conclusion of linting. Useful if running pylint in a server-like mode. (default: False)

options.name: --prefer-stubs
options.description: Resolve imports to .pyi stubs if available. May reduce no-member messages and increase not-an-iterable messages. (default: False)

options.name: --output-format
options.description: Set the output format. Available formats are: 'text', 'parseable', 'colorized', 'json2' (improved json format), 'json' (old json format), msvs (visual studio) and 'github' (GitHub actions). You can also give a reporter class, e.g. mypackage.mymodule.MyReporterClass.

options.name: --reports
options.description: Tells whether to display a full report or only the messages. (default: False)

options.name: --evaluation
options.description: Python expression which should return a score less than or equal to 10. You have access to the variables 'fatal', 'error', 'warning', 'refactor', 'convention', and 'info' which contain the number of messages in each category, as well as 'statement' which is the total number of statements analyzed. This score is used by the global evaluation report (RP0004). (default: max(0, 0 if fatal else 10.0 - ((float(5 * error + warning + refactor + convention) / statement) * 10)))

options.name: --score
options.description: Activate the evaluation score. (default: True)

options.name: --msg-template
options.description: Template used to display messages. This is a python new-style format string used to format the message information. See doc for all details. (default: )

options.name: --confidence
options.description: Only show warnings with the listed confidence levels. Leave empty to show all. Valid levels: HIGH, CONTROL_FLOW, INFERENCE, INFERENCE_FAILURE, UNDEFINED. (default: ['HIGH', 'CONTROL_FLOW', 'INFERENCE', 'INFERENCE_FAILURE', 'UNDEFINED'])

options.name: --enable
options.description: Enable the message, report, category or checker with the given id(s). You can either give multiple identifier separated by comma (,) or put this option multiple time (only on the command line, not in the configuration file where it should appear only once). See also the "--disable" option for examples.

options.name: --disable
options.description: Disable the message, report, category or checker with the given id(s). You can either give multiple identifiers separated by comma (,) or put this option multiple times (only on the command line, not in the configuration file where it should appear only once). You can also use "--disable=all" to disable everything first and then re-enable specific checks. For example, if you want to run only the similarities checker, you can use "--disable=all --enable=similarities". If you want to run only the classes checker, but have no Warning level messages displayed, use "--disable=all --enable=classes --disable=W".

options.name: --ignore-on-opaque-inference
options.description: This flag controls whether pylint should warn about no-member and similar checks whenever an opaque object is returned when inferring. The inference can return multiple potential results while evaluating a Python object, but some branches might not be evaluated, which results in partial inference. In that case, it might be useful to still emit no-member and other checks for the rest of the inferred objects. (default: True)

options.name: --mixin-class-rgx
options.description: Regex pattern to define which classes are considered mixins. (default: .*[Mm]ixin)

options.name: --ignore-mixin-members
options.description: Tells whether missing members accessed in mixin class should be ignored. A class is considered mixin if its name matches the mixin-class-rgx option. (default: True)

options.name: --ignored-checks-for-mixins
options.description: List of symbolic message names to ignore for Mixin members. (default: ['no-member', 'not-async-context-manager', 'not-context-manager', 'attribute-defined-outside-init'])

options.name: --ignore-none
options.description: Tells whether to warn about missing members when the owner of the attribute is inferred to be None. (default: True)

options.name: --ignored-classes
options.description: List of class names for which member attributes should not be checked (useful for classes with dynamically set attributes). This supports the use of qualified names. (default: ('optparse.Values', 'thread._local', '_thread._local', 'argparse.Namespace'))

options.name: --generated-members
options.description: List of members which are set dynamically and missed by pylint inference system, and so shouldn't trigger E1101 when accessed. Python regular expressions are accepted. (default: ())

options.name: --contextmanager-decorators
options.description: List of decorators that produce context managers, such as contextlib.contextmanager. Add to this list to register other decorators that produce valid context managers. (default: ['contextlib.contextmanager'])

options.name: --missing-member-hint-distance
options.description: The minimum edit distance a name should have in order to be considered a similar match for a missing member name. (default: 1)

options.name: --missing-member-max-choices
options.description: The total number of similar names Pylint should display as hints for a missing member name. (default: 1)

options.name: --missing-member-hint
options.description: Show suggestions for attributes marked as missing. (default: True)

options.name: --signature-mutators
options.description: List of decorators that change the signature of the decorated function.
